intro: Apomuria angustifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaf apomuria, is a species of flowering plant in the family Apocynaceae. It is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. The plant is native to certain regions of Central and South America, where it thrives in tropical and subtropical climates. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. The plant contains various alkaloids, which can make it toxic to animals and humans if ingested.
